When we woke up to a steady stream of water in the basement from our air conditioning unit, we immediately reached out to Plus One Heating and Air. A few hours later, expert technician Mark McClellan arrived, quickly assessed the situation, and determined that we needed a new condensate pump.

Markâ€™s kindness, attentiveness, and attention to detail stood out every step of the way. He not only solved the problem efficiently but also took the time to test everything thoroughly, ensuring our system was working properly before he left. His professionalism, expertise, and genuine joy in his work truly set him apart.

We are incredibly grateful for the quick response and top-notch service from Plus One, and especially for Markâ€”who is, without a doubt, the best of the best! Highly recommend!

reviews.text: We CANNOT say enough about Daniel and Plus One! HE WAS AMAZING!!! I mean just went above and beyond for us in so many ways. reviews.author: Jared Taylor
reviews.text:
We moved into this house 4 years ago (built in â€˜90) and knew the HVAC units were old with some parts being from the original build. Our ductwork was full of mold and our electric bill was through the roof. We knew it was finally time to replace them and had four different companies come out and give estimates. We were the most impressed with Daniel at Plus One. They pointed out where our original install was designed improperly and completely redid both our upstairs and downstairs systems including all new duct work. We also felt like their pricing was more reasonable than some other companies we received quotes from.

The new systems are very nice and we now have a dual fuel heat pump for both floors of the house. Gadge and Myles did most of the install work and we couldnâ€™t have been happier with their work. They did a great install and were very professional and hardworking whenever they were here.

If you are looking for a company and are not sure who to choose because every company is giving you different answers on what your home needs I recommend going with Plus One. They take a scientific approach to ensuring all of your ductwork is sized correctly for proper airflow. They installed dampers and adjusted the airflow in each room to meet the needs of the space. Most of this stuff other companies didnâ€™t offer to do.

The new system works more efficiently and is quieter than our old system. We also had the AprilAire whole home air cleaner installed to help with our allergies. The ductwork was really well done and passed pressure testing with flying colors. Our old ductwork was really leaky and had so many holes in it. This new ductwork is made from sheet metal wrapped in insulation and will last for decades.

They customized the install to meet our homeâ€™s specific needs and didnâ€™t insist on one size fits all. We will continue to use Plus One to service our new systems for life. We had a great experience with everyone we dealt with at Plus One. They definitely earned a five star review.
reviews.ownerResponse: Thank you Jared for trusting us with your home. You are one of the few in Birmingham that can say they have a custom designed HVAC system. We appreciate you allowing Daniel to have the time to go through the project and explain the process in detail. It can be time consuming on the quote, but I know you see why we do it. Daniel is one of the best, and we couldn't be happier that he has been with us for over 5 years now. We look forward to serving you and your family for any AC or Heating needs.

reviews.author: clayr99
reviews.text: I purchased a condo for my son who is in college who has a lot of allergies and was getting sick from being there.   I worked with multiple HVAC companies to try to resolve the multiple issues that were found with the system.   Plus One reviewed the system, cleaned the coils and blower and identified that my system was installed poorly with multiple code violations.   They completed a total system reinstall and solved all of the issues.   They ( Alan, Myles and Gadge) were very professional and completed the work efficiently.   They were very fair with the pricing for everything.  I would definitely recommend them!!!
reviews.ownerResponse: Thank you for your wonderful review, clayr99! Weâ€™re thrilled to hear that our teamâ€”Alan, Myles, and Gadgeâ€”was able to resolve the issues with your HVAC system effectively. Your satisfaction and recommendation mean a lot to us. We appreciate your trust and look forward to assisting you again in the future!

reviews.author: JOHN ABBOTT
reviews.text:

We are grateful that there are still people around that actually give a shit and take pride in their work.....
reviews.ownerResponse: Thank you John. We appreciate you allowing us to serve you and your team. We try to live up to our name. Plus One, we want to do what we say, and then some. We look forward to serving you and your business with any AC and Heating needs.

reviews.text: My husband has called infinity out to repair our upstairs heating and air conditioning unit two different times and Doug has found the problem and fixed it both times and this is an older unit. reviews.author: Jenny McCune
reviews.text:
Awesome experience!  This is an honest, family-run business.  They responded quickly to my call.  Even though I had a 23 year old unit, the technician worked to repair the system.  He did not make me feel that the unit must be replaced immediately.  I appreciated his attempts, but knew the unit was on its way out.  When the unit finally gave out again, I made the decision to replace the unit.  Infinity gave me an extremely reasonable and competitive quote.  They also offered excellent, manageable financing with a well known institution.
The unit replacement process was  completed in one day with little inconvenience to me.  The technicians were neat, efficient, professional & friendly.  After the unit was replaced I had a few questions, and the company owner was quick to come by my home and address the situation.  He left me with a feeling of confidence that he guaranteed their work and the system installed.
Infinity Air Solutions gave my home cool air again, coming from a new, beautiful Trane unit along with the education of its operations.  (Yes, it was beautiful to me, after spending two weeks in this summer's 100 degree weather.)  They also left me with the feeling that they would be there if I had any future needs.  I will be calling them in the future for regular maintenance on my new unit.
I highly recommend Infinity Air Solutions, Heating & Air Conditioning.
Jenny McCune
Bluff Park, Hoover, AL
reviews.ownerResponse: Thank you so much for the awesome review.  I greatly appreciate your kind words.  We would not be anything without our amazing customers.  You are why we do what we do and how we do it.  If you are not 100% satisfied with our work, we have not done our job properly.  Our #1 priority is our customers happiness and satisfaction.  Welcome to the Infinity Air Solutions family.  Thank you!

reviews.text: We love Doug and Nicole. Always prompt service and always on time. I had to replace my ac/heating unit, I told him what I wanted he got that for me and made me very happy!

reviews.author: Michael Kuhl
reviews.text: We had a 25-year-old system replaced (both AC and heat) that was definitely on its last legs. Pricing was middle of the road (some bids higher, some lower), but this outfit sent out a knowledgeable young man who answered our questions, and showed up when he said he would, to remove the old system and install the new one, which has worked flawlessly since. We moved here (thanks to my former employer) from California, so the climate change was rather spectacular, from an area with much dryer weather to the typical heat and humidity one finds in this part of the world. We do seem to be saving somewhat on power usage, but will not really know until a complete set of seasons has passed. All in all, dealing with Infinity Air was a good experience.
reviews.ownerResponse: We appreciate your kind words. Thank you for doing business with Infinity Air Solutions, Inc.

reviews.text: Very pleased with my overall experience.  Doug was very nice and arrived within the time frame he gave me. He had my air up and going within an hour. reviews.text: Great Service! Very honest people and will not try and rip you off. I recently had an experience with the thermostat not having any display and the AC unit shut off. Just for a second opinion, I called infinity solutions. We had Doug (technician) come over and gave us the most honest opinion and fixed our AC for less than $300. Please do not go to freedom HVAC in Bessemer as they are into the business of ripping people off. I would like to recommend Infinity to anyone in need of HVAC service and repair.
reviews.ownerResponse: We appreciate you giving us a chance to prove ourselves & hope to maintain a life long relationship with you. We do not aim to rip anyone off & it is very disappointing to hear about other companies doing just that. We are not in the business of making a quick buck off of any customer, ever! Thank you for your kind words, it means everything to us to know we are making our customers happy. Again, thank you!

reviews.text: These guys are A1.  On-time for every call and very responsive. I was there for the install and they were very professional and efficient installing all new ductwork. reviews.author: Andria Cimino
reviews.text: I remain blown away by the positive experience I had with Daniel and team at Temperature Pro. Our 3ton 2005 HVAC system had died and we needed a full replacement. We had also noticed hot and cool spots on the  upstairs floor serviced by the system. Daniel conducted a thorough inspection of the old system and our duct work, then provided a clear explanation of the various issues followed by highly detailed estimates for replacing the old system. He patiently answered myriad questions, including a couple that required a bit of research. He provided a second set of estimates for a different system to help us stay within budget. He made sure replacements were Energy Star and offered excellent warranties and financing w/Greensky. He was able to schedule the installation when we needed it and his team were on time, professional, and cleaned up when they were finished! Communication with the office staff was also professional and prompt. Daniel and the others at TempPro earned our trust and we will be hiring them for biannual maintenance and any future HVAC repairs/installations. reviews.author: Kaitlyn Brown
reviews.text:
PLEASE READ before you use this company. We originally were sent Affordable Heating and Air through a claim with Old Republic in 2021. They came out and fixed what was needed and we had a good experience. We flip and rent houses and have had multiple units replaced through Old Republic through Affordable Heating and Air. They told us to contact their nephew Nate (their technician) for our needs and we have for years. In Dec 2023, Nate quoted us a unit and we sent him money for it. Weeks went by without installation and then he said he needed more money for an upgrade of which we sent. $5,200 WAS STOLEN FROM US. When I say stole, he literally texted us and told us he USED OUR MONEY FOR CHILD SUPPORT AND WILL PAY US BACK. I have the texts. Itâ€™s insane. But what is more insane is that his family and owners would let a long time customer be robbed and not make us whole. It tells you everything you need to know about how they run a business.

We contacted his aunt who is the owner of the company and even after hearing everything, she offered for us to pay $4k MORE at supposed cost to â€œmake it rightâ€. We originally said no that we wanted our unit for the price agreed upon and we wouldnâ€™t be outlaying any more money until it was installed. Two days later once we realized we just needed to get it done, we call back and say fine, we will pay the money and just lose out on the rest since you wonâ€™t take responsibility for your employee/nephew that STOLE FROM US. At that point she then said that they no longer were offering a discount and basically told us to fly a kite. If you do use them, do not outlay any money until the unit is installed. I hope Old Republic will end their contract with them so nobody else is a victim like we were.

I took this review down originally because after posting it, the owner Russell called me to tell me that he really would fix it and he was sorry that there was a miscommunication. We talked for 30 minutes and I agreed to take it down. After a week and a half has gone by and he refuses to answer or return my call, I have no choice but to put it back up. I am the only victim here and have still not received my $5,200 back that was stolen from me. These people are thieves and liars. I cannot believe they think it is okay to conduct their business this way. My sister also paid them $2,000 for work that we can also not get a call back on. Do not associate with this company. The Alabaster inspector says he will be reporting them to the state board.

Affordable Heating and Air was sent to my house as part of American Home Shield Home Warranty program. The technician NEVER put a gauge on the condensing unit to check refrigerant levels. He told me what a horrible company Ahs is, and while I agree, he attempted to price gouge me at a $199.00 per pound, Iâ€™ve been paying $50.00 per pound. He never asked if I wanted him to, but rather stated, â€œI know you donâ€™t want me to do this and I donâ€™t blame you, if it was mine, I wouldnâ€™t do it either. Iâ€™ll send in the report telling them what I found.â€ He sent in the report and stated customer refused to allow him to add refrigerant. He did not have to add 8 lbs of refrigerant to test the system, but this was his way of making a quick buck thinking unsuspecting customers will not know. I would highly recommend you FIND
ANOTHER COMPANY to do your hvac work. The audacity of attempting to charge $200 per lb is ignorant at best and is the definition of a scam artist at worst. The lies to me and deceptive trade practices by never putting a gauge on the equipment, and stating I refused is repugnant. DO NOT USE these folks, and never buy a home warranty from American Home Shield, Iâ€™m wondering now if they are colluding to unsuspecting customers?

reviews.text: I have had a very bad experience with Affordable Care Heating and Air. My home warranty gave them my claim to fix my heating and air in November, that was 3 weeks ago. The people said they would be giving me a call to put the part in, so I waited to receive a call back.  I didn't receive a call back.  Home Warranty said that Affordable Care Heating and Air would be giving me a call back.  They first came to put the blower in the heating unit upstairs at the beginning of November. Instead of fixing the downstairs heating, they closed the case.  So I am left sitting in the freezing cold. I called the company, they were supposed to fix the claim. They had to order the parts. The part came Wednesday before Thanksgiving. They said they would put the part on Monday and give me a call. I received no call, no txt, no nothing. I call back to the company to see when they were putting the part in. Owner of Affordable Care company called said they withdraw claim because I have been harassing them. Now I have to start the procedure all over because the women lied on me. I never harassed anyone. I only called the company one time to see when they would be fixing my heating unit.  Not only that, but I am still cold and don't have any heat. Furthermore, I feel like I have been lied on by the company. I do not recommend anyone do business with this company. If she lies on me, who else will she lie on. I'm freezing with no heat because of a lie she told just to get out of fixing my heating unit.

We appreciate when our customers recognize this in our employees and the work we do. Thanks again! We look forward to assisting you in the future.

reviews.text: I just want to take a minute to brag. Their employees are highly- skilled, honest and professional. They truly care about their customers and it shows. Thank you, Trinity for being Exceptional! I highly recommend to everyoneâ¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

reviews.author: Agnes Karanja
reviews.text: Changed un necessary changes like his vehicle oil change tire and travel time which is 4 times more than government charges anything about me .did not seem to have rights tool to find leaks inside wall end up making 4 holes in my wall
reviews.ownerResponse:
Hi! I am sorry to hear you are dissatisfied with your experience using Trinity for your water leak repair. Our charges are very similar to those of the competition and in many cases, lower, but are most definitely in line with industry standards. We do charge a standard vehicle charge of $50 for normal wear and tear items related to the vehicle, and having the truck stocked with items for various repairs, and then travel time to the location since we do have to pay our technicians for that time associated with your individual job. Again, both of these are standard industry practices and are in line with other service providers of the same nature. 

Unfortunately with water leaks behind a wall, we do have to usually make several holes in the wall in our efforts to identify the leak. While this is not ideal for the homeowner, it isn't possible to know where a leak behind a wall is without the investigative processes, nor can it be repaired without making access holes once it is identified. We do, however, offer sheetrock services as an additional convenience to expedite the wall repairs for our clients.

reviews.author: Owen Harris
reviews.text: Called Trinity and they got a technician out here in a couple of hours - all work done quickly and professionally.  Highly recommend!

It has affected our response time in some instances. We are constantly working to stay on top of it while continuing to provide the service our customers have trusted us to provide since 1981.  Again, we sincerely apologize for the oversight in this case and greatly appreciate you making the extra effort on our behalf to allow us to assist you.

We would have gladly sent a manager out to evaluate the installation if you felt it was not correct had we been contacted regarding a problem following the original work that was performed on 9/20/18. We will be glad to evaluate this matter further if you would please contact us at 205-655-5099 with more specific information as to what was not correct, etc. We look forward to speaking with you as to a resolve.

reviews.text:
Unfortunately over the years I have had my share of plumbing issues at my home and therefore in need of services. Last month Trinity came to my house and did a great job at a really fair price and that alone is enough to use Trinity again, however what impressed me heads above any company I had used in the past is how friendly and professional they all are, from operator to dispatch and service tech's.
Today a month later I need a different plumbing issue resolved and you guessed it, Trinity is on for today.

reviews.text: I had electrical work done in my house. Trinity went above and beyond to make sure that all of my electrical needs were met. What I loved most is that they offered the professional advice that I was seeking and saved me a lot of money! Thank you Trinity!

reviews.author: D Trimble
reviews.text: I called Trinity Service Dept. for a second opinion following my semi-annual HVAC service by another HVAC company.  Their tech told me I had a severe problem with bacteria in the ductwork in my attic and that it would cost about $5k to rectify.  Doug King came out and checked out my attic/ductwork and told me I do not have any such problem, that my ductwork is very clean.  He even took/gave me pictures that I could show the other HVAC company to report their tech.  He was friendly, courteous, knowledgeable, and saved me from being taken advantage of by another company.  Doug King rocks!  I will be using Trinity Contractors for future HVAC service as they earned my trust.
reviews.ownerResponse: Thank you for the kind review. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us.

reviews.author: Daniel Walker
reviews.text: Soooo I had a trinity tech. Come and look the air ducts in my finished basement because they were sweating and staining my drop ceiling tiles. The tech was very friendly and somewhat helpful as to a possible solution. He was supposed to get with his supervisor and work up a quote to do the job. I didn't hear back from anyone for almost 2 weeks and that was only because I kept having to call to talk to someone until I finally lost my patience and made a scene on the phone with the poor girl who answered. The guy finally called me back apologized for not calling me back and said it was because they were coming up with a solution...( to which I thought we already had). We talked and came up with another solution and I asked for a price for that.... again haven't heard from him until I had to call.... still haven't gotten a quote!!!!! I am a very unhappy customer!!! Do not ever use this company!!!
reviews.ownerResponse: Hi, Mr. Walker. I sincerely apologize for your experience.  I do show our records indicate we provided a proposal on the 18th of July. Obviously it took more time than preferred. We sincerely apologize. We were not aware of the delay at the time but we have spoken with this individual and do not anticipate any future issues.

reviews.author: jennifer east
reviews.text: Called them to perform a job and emailed Cary the paperwork that he asked me to send him. He never came out to see the house nor did he return my calls. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!
reviews.ownerResponse: We sincerely apologize this occurred. Cary is no longer with us. We are learning he knew he was going to be resigning several months before he did so. Unfortunately, we were not aware he was missing his estimates at the time. We hope you will give us a second chance in the future.

reviews.author: Dianna Richardson
reviews.text: We called a technician out on yesterday for my 87 years old father heater and they charged him 110.00 with no results. I asked the technician how long would it take for the house to heat up he said a while by it being cold outside but Iâ€™m not thinking 24hours. Please come fix my fathers heat please!!!!!!

As one of the largest service providers in the State, we stand behind our work 110%. We do offer a 30 day warranty on all service repairs performed (longer in some cases depending on the repair or installation performed), so hopefully you contacted us by phone at the time for additional resolution.

reviews.author: Kewonda Carr
reviews.text: My home warranty assigned this company to fix my AC issues this past September. Itâ€™s obvious that Elijah patch the unit up outside to get the fan running and cooling again. It is now a month later my AC went out again. I put a claim in and they did a recall so he could come back out again to fix the issue. It was dispatched to him early Thursday morning but I didnâ€™t hear from him until Friday morning at 8. He said he would be back out to fix it and would call me around 10. I never received a phone call. I called him but no answer and I left a voicemail. I tried calling 30 minutes later. Phone ring immediately was sent to voicemail. I then text him and told him that it is 90 degrees outside so itâ€™s even hotter inside the house. I had just brought my mom home from being in the hospital for 20 days due to finding out she has cancer so the last thing I need her to be uncomfortable in this way. I saying all this to say that a company should never conduct business this way by not acknowledging a conversation. This company needs to be banned from all warranty companies because this is unacceptable. So please who ever that is about to use this guy, DONâ€™T!!!!! Poor way of conducting business.

reviews.author: Eric Stadler
reviews.text: All I can say is avoid at all cost. Do not allow the home warranty company to assign A&E as you provider. They are hard to communicate with, donâ€™t answer calls, sometimes will text, and arrive hours late for the appointment time if they arrive at all. They promise to call back but never do and you will spend hours trying to contact them. They left us without AC for two weeks and then put a hard start kit in to try to get the unit going until a compressor came in. Two weeks of 90 plus temps in my house when it could have been done on the first day. My compressor was never installed (second week of July now) so I had to pay another service fee to have another company fix my AC which by the way was NOT the compressor. I now have working AC after 20 minutes of another company fixing my AC that had been down since May.

Finally at 7pm he called to say he wasnâ€™t coming because the entire unit needed to be replaced. HE NEVER CAME- NEVER SAW THE AC.  He is a joke and a liar. reviews.text: Elijah Blanchard responded to our residential air system after it went out.  My wife spoke with him late evening, and he was at our house early a.m. the next morning battling the rain. After investigating the entire system, he replaced the needed parts, and as promised, he said you will have your air back (before he started) and it was back! He is very courteous, professional, and definitely excellent pricing.  Out of 5 Stars, we give him a 6!

reviews.text: Elijah did an outstanding job with the repair of our unit. I have a home warranty and feel very fortunate that he was assigned to our job.

reviews.author: Julie Nelson
reviews.text: I have a home warranty through American Home Shield.  Our central AC went out and they assigned A & E Service Co., They were supposed to be here between 10 and noon.  Never a phone call that they were going to be late, they just didn't show up.  I called at 1:00 pm, they said they would call me back in 15 minutes.  An hour and a half later I canceled the service request through American Home Shield.  Still no phone call.  Terrible customer service!

Marie y el dueÃ±o Elijah hicieron un buen  Trabajo. Definitivamente recomiendo esta compaÃ±ia.

reviews.author: Donell Williams
reviews.text: My warranty company assigned my service call to A&E Services, at the beginning after reading the reviews I was concerned, but it turned out to be the opposite. The technician came to my house at the time that it was scheduled. I needed the furnace to be replaced and in short time they replaced my unit. Iâ€™m satisfied with the quality of service that was provided and the professionalism of the technician and owner.

reviews.author: Candice Walker
reviews.text: I went through my warranty company to use A&E services and they came to look at my HVAC unit the night I called them. I had issues with the warranty company,  but the technician, Elijah, always made sure I was kept in the loop about what was going on. Once things were straightened out with the warranty company,  they put my new unit in within 2 days. They even worked in the rain and in the dark to make sure I could get heat! I am very grateful for their great work!

reviews.author: Russell Roberts
reviews.text: Never again.

reviews.text: Bought Sears Home Warranty from A& E Tech fixed my dishwasher and did such a great job, quickly and affordably. Once under contract the service took a turn for the worst. Air conditioner stopped working, they missed the Friday appointment with no communication. Came in Saturday. Did not have a condenser to fix my air conditioner. Ordered the part Monday. It is Monday night, 4 days later with no air conditioner. A&E does not go the extra mile to help.

reviews.author: Terry Allen

They advised me they had another stop then they would be at my house.   Never showed up and never called back to let me know they couldn't make it.  I'm glad they didn't with the rating they have.  Poor customer service so their work is probably like their customer ser vice

reviews.author: Carly Avery
reviews.text:
This is the WORST company. IT IS 95+ DEGREES RIGHT NOW. This company has had us without AC for weeks now. I wish there was an option for 0 stars because they donâ€™t even deserve 1.
This company does not keep you informed. They are not all on the same page, communication is awful. The â€œCEOâ€ Elijah just makes excuses for stuff not getting done.
End of story.. Do NOT use this company ever if your home warranty company suggests them.

reviews.author: Leon Lomax
reviews.text: LG Company sent out A & E  for a repair and the service tech didn't try to repair anything. He wanted to replace without touching or seeing what was going on. I had another company come a repair the problem less than 30 minutes.

reviews.author: Dewyon Dewyon
reviews.text: Worst company ever, this guy has had me without AC for two months and he keeps disregarding my calls,texts, and emails with a different lie every day. Please do not use this guy we need to put people like this out of business he is a ripoff to top it off when he did come to put in my new compressor he burned the new one up putting it in then lied to me if it was my coil gone bad. Had another company come in and tell me that he burnt up a brand new compressor and there was all kind of debris around my unit he did not even bother to clean behind himself.

reviews.author: Gary Mitchell
reviews.text: This company doesn't keep you informed when someone will arrive to make repairs.  The owner says one thing and the tech says he wasn't aware and no one calls you back to let you know that the repair tech isn't coming.  Ypu will spend hours trying to track them down and their voice mail due to being full won't allow you to leave a message.  My American Shield warranty sent them.  The company is located over 90 minutes away from the repair site.  I will never use them again.

reviews.author: Raymond Rice
reviews.text: This is the worst company I have ever dealt with they were scheduled to arrive at my house on June7 at between 8 and 5 no one showed up and no one call, their customers service is bad all they do is lie do not do business with this company

reviews.author: Bloody Wolf
reviews.text: The worst company EVER! Never fixed the problem completely. Air stopped working 2 weeks later and I called, the home warranty company called and they would hang up on them!!!  Do not use them! Avoid at all cost. The only reason that I gave them 1 star is because there was no place for a 0!

reviews.author: jacob gibbs
reviews.text: It is interesting that one of the few positive reviews is Elijah, the owner, that has to be a conflict of interest.

reviews.author: Jon Ward
reviews.text: They look for techs for 13-14 an hour, they offer part time hours and you have to provide your own vehicle. Now compare that to most decent service companies who furnish a company vehicle and pay 20+ an hour. This should explain what kind of tech you are going to get. Home warranty companies love these types of companies which lead to these types of reviews. Home warranty on your HVAC is always going to be a loose loose situation and these companies are always going to minimize cost .

reviews.author: John Schenk
reviews.text: This service is so bad that the only people giving it five stars are the ones working for the company.....check the reviews!!!

reviews.author: Animagus
reviews.text: I wish i could give this pathetic excuse for a company less than one star. If you have to work with them through the HWA, go ahead and request service from a different company so your time isn't wasted. I've been without heat for 14 days. I have a family including two kids under 3 and am at my absolute wits' end. I've had to spend the holidays at my mother's house, mother-in-law's and anywhere else we can find a bed because these buffoons can't do their job. It's obvious that they don't want to do their job and have no desire to help customers. They've played the blame game, not shown up to at least FOUR appointments after they've called me saying they were on their way and haven't communicated ANYTHING to me after multiple issues with this claim. They've also sent 4 different people out each time I've needed assistance who have all given 4 explanations as to what our "problem" is. You'd think that a business would at least have the wherewithal and internal communication skills to talk about an issue so they can problem solve it, right? THINK AGAIN! There is no logic. There is no rhyme or reason and there certainly is NO customer service. Look somewhere else.

reviews.author: Bonnie Maddox
reviews.text: I have never done a review before, but need to share that this is the worst customer service we have ever received. We had two different appointments for service scheduled and were stood up both times without phone calls. Then we tried to reschedule for a third time and nobody returned our calls.  We will have to call someone else.

reviews.author: Keshanti Morgan-Flowers
reviews.text: We too were referred to this company by the Home Warranty service and similar to many others, we experienced the most unprofessional and unreliable Technician by the name of Andre...he showed up for the initial service appointment on time to perform a diagnostic on our heating system and told us "the inducer motor burned out"  got the 60.00 service payment and disappeared.  From that point he lied about coming to install the motor, lied about picking up the part and then finally this dude blocked my number.  He is the reason most independent businesses fail and sad to say I believe this company will fail to bc of poor customer service and lack of integrity.

reviews.author: Chris Potter
reviews.text: They were sent by my home warranty company. They didn't show up when promised then tried to say that there was nothing wrong with my air conditioner.  When my unit froze up again, I called the them and the home warranty company. They never came back and I had to pay someone else to fix my a/c.  Don't call this company unless you want to get screwed over.

reviews.author: Branden Saccomani
reviews.text:
Would give zero stars if

reviews.text: Would not recommend to anyone! We were sent this company through our homeowners insurance company. They scheduled to come out between 12-130. We gave up waiting around 10pm and called our homeowners insurance to report and change companies. Very unprofessional to not show up let alone lie about being on the way....Also to no surprise Elijah Blanchard (the owner/guy we talked to) is one of the 5 star reviews.

reviews.text: My home warranty company assigned A&E Service when both my HVAC systems went out at the same time. I called to check on status after hearing from no one on their promised day of delivery.  It took contacting my home warranty company to get them moving.  Keep in mind it is Summer in AL and my upstairs has no AC.  They had not provided an update to the home warranty company nor had they ordered the part.  Terrible communication and follow through.

reviews.author: Susan Farley
reviews.text: My husband and I purchased a Mitsubishi Mini Split from Alabama Cooling and Heating November 01, 2024. The installation crew was amazing. They removed and disposed of the old unit and installed the new unit very quickly. They cleaned up all debris. They were very professional. My complaint is after the installation. I realized they didn't leave a bill of sales or the owners manual, warranty info etc. I called the office and spoke with Kenzy. She said she will get everything from the crew and mail it the following morning. A week passed and no paperwork. I have made numerous calls and sent many emails with no response. I did receive 2 email replies from Kenzy saying everything was in the mail. And when we didn't receive the paperwork I emailed again and called her out on the lies. She told me to go online and print out a manual. I said no! I want the original manual and paperwork that came with the unit and we paid for. She sent another email saying they were working with Mitsubishi to get another manual. What happened to the original? We did get a receipt on November 12th. It's now March 20, 2025 and still no paperwork. If you do business with this company make sure you get all your paperwork the day of service or you'll never get it. I have no issues with the crew just the lack of customer service.

reviews.text: Was told I needed a new compressor and couldnâ€™t get it and needed to replace my entire unit. Called someone else and the compressor was in stock in Gardendale, they came out and looked at everything. Didnâ€™t actually need a compressor. The changed a few wires and cleaned the coils and everything is working just fine.
reviews.ownerResponse: We are sorry for any inconveniences you may have had, we gave our opinion and never charged anything to give our opinion, when a system is over 20 years old with R22 refrigeration we will always recommend a replacement. When the technician checked the compressor the readings he gathered were incorrect. While we could have installed a new compressor the indoor coil would have needed to be replaced as well to work with the new refrigerant which is why we informed you guys it would make more sense to replace the system. Putting $500 or more into a system that age in our opinion is a waste of money, but you are entitled to do what you see fit with your system which is why we always encourage getting a second opinion Iâ€™m glad that they got the system up and running.

reviews.text: We decided it was time to have our AC units serviced, so I reached out to Cool Temp Air at the recommendation of a friend. Both units at our house are older, but rather than trying to sell me something I don't need today, Ron, the technician, was able to keep things up and running and it didn't break the bank. He helped educate me on different parts of the unit and what to do when it is time to finally get a whole new unit (and hopefully how to avoid needing two at the same time!) At no time did I feel like he was trying to sell me on anything I didn't need. He was professional and courteous. We will definitely be calling them for our annual service as well as for anything that comes up in between!

We highly recommend this company!

Michelle, Jacob, and Milo! THIS is exactly why we started 1st Choice. I have witnessed some horrible scenarios in my time in the HVAC business in the Birmingham Metro area. It makes it hard for people to trust any HVAC company. We aim to change that...one household at a time. reviews.author: Ashley Clarie
reviews.text:
I wish I could give them ten stars because they deserve every one.  Bo Jiffy is our heat and cooling company from now on warranty or no. 4 different companies  were sent out. The first tech couldn't figure it out, the second tech rigged it up to run on heat strips which meant the air would never work, the third guy said that we needed a new system that of course the warranty company would not cover. Robert from Bo Jiffy was the charm. He was thorough and checked the system back and forth multiple times. Even once he had everything up and running he ran the air tested it then the heat and tested it then the air again and then the heat again. So far so good.  He was quick professional and best of all he actually fixed the issue. Robert kept us informed about his location so we were not waiting all day wondering when he would show up. I can't sing their praises enough. This is one very satisfied customer.

I am so impressed. I was super leery  of dealing with another technician because the people that our warranty company has been sending out have been quite awful. He restored my  faith in the warranty company and repair people all of them aren't awful money grubbing liars even though most of them seem to be. Rest assured they will be thorough and take care of you. If you have choice warranty I suggest you cut out the headache and specifically ask for this company. They are worth the wait if there is one. Our work order was put in on Saturday they were out here  on Monday.

I love to have reasons to compliment a company and they gave me plenty.
reviews.ownerResponse: We use a professional approach to give you the service you deserve! Thank you

reviews.author: Delynn Bouldin
reviews.text:
In the midst of a heatwave, we called about our A/C being down. We were told they would do their very best to get to us the following day. At 12:20 in the day they were to come, Caleb called and asked if it was convenient for him to come. We said yes and he was there in 15 minutes.

He quickly found the bad capacitor and replaced it.  He also found that our refrigerant was low and added 2 pounds of R-410A.  He was very friendly and professional, worked quickly, and and made sure we were happy before he left.

Even though the markup on the replacement capacitor was exorbitant, we were still pleased with the friendly, on-time service and the professionalism of the tch, Caleb.

reviews.author: Miss Rod
reviews.text:
UPDATE:
So I got a call from Grissom Brother's on yesterday. The customer service rep expressed the company's concern with my customer service experience. Apparently I was overcharged. I should not have been charged the diagnostic fee once I accepted service. She also explained that I received the best product for my situation and that the price was on par with receiving quality product and labor. She surprisingly rectified the situation by giving me a huge discount for my trouble instead of just refunding the diagnostic fee. I really appreciated that! ðŸ˜Š

I must say, superior customer service, as I received from Grissom Brother's on yesterday is priceless! Based on their integrity alone,  I'd not only highly recommend them but use them again.

ORIGINAL POST:
So I just had the capacitor on my AC unit fixed. It took the guy at most 15 minutes to fix. The cost was about $355 plus the $85 diagnostic fee. This is a bit pricy for not even 30 minutes worth of work with a part that is not that expensive. Online research revealed that an appropriate price for this work is between $100 and $150, if you choose not to do it yourself. And if that's not enough, it's extra to use a credit card. Wow!!!

I guess I shouldn't have been trying to get the air fixed so fast and through the warranty; which didn't help because the part wasn't even covered. And since it was going to cost me $85 anyway, I went ahead with the service...big mistake ðŸ˜•. I mean, the dude showed me a price list on his phone; I should have known something since he didn't have an actual one to show me...smh. This is the first time reviews let me down. One of their customers gets an $11,000 quote from a competitor but the problem is fixed for less than $100 by them. Guess that wasn't a real review "fake news". ðŸ¤”ðŸ¤¨ðŸ™„â˜¹ï¸ðŸ˜’

On a positive note, although the technician spelled my name completely wrong on the invoice, he was nice, fast talking and moving but nice.
reviews.ownerResponse: We certainly hated to find out this happened but very pleased to make it right with you. We value all of our customers and will do what's right to make them happy if at all possible. We look forward to serving you again!

reviews.author: Lori Mccrea
reviews.text:
When it was time to replace our HVAC and hot water heater the first quote we received (from another company) seemed unreasonably high. A neighbor highly recommended getting a quote from AGA HVAC  Services as they replaced the same systems for her the previous year.

AGA provided a detailed quote, very competitive pricing, and was happy to answer ALL of our questions. Thankfully, they were able to coordinate the install of both systems to take place on the same day. The entire team was professional, friendly, and did a great job.  Following the install, they were very helpful (and patient) in providing an A-Z overview of the new Nest smart thermostat. They also completed the online ownerâ€™s registration for the HVAC system which extended our warranty another 5 years.

Prior to leaving, the owner provided his cell number with instructions to call if we had any follow-up questions regarding the new smart thermostat rather than referring us to the ownerâ€™s manual. A week following the installation, the owner followed up to see if we had any questions or issues. This level of customer support is MUCH appreciated!

I would definitely recommend AGA HVAC Services to others, and we will call on them again for any future HVAC and/or plumbing needs.

reviews.author: Jason P
reviews.text:
Horrible experience.  I called about a clogged kitchen sink and had a 1430 appointment scheduled for Friday. I called 30-45 minutes after the appointment because the repairman had not shown up or called.  He ended up being over 3 hours late.  He spent a little over an hour snaking and plunging the sink (both things that I told him I had been doing repeatedly the last 24-48 hours). He didnâ€™t have anything fixed, charged $175 and we scheduled another appointment for Sunday at 0700.  This time he was over 4 hours late. He spent the first hour and a half doing the exact same two things he did on Friday that didnâ€™t work.  He then needlessly cut the pipe under the sink that he had already disconnected in order to snake it and had to go get materials to repair it.  He was gone for an hour.  He repaired it after coming back and then went into the attic to try and snake the clog from another direction.  He said he was going to use a drain bladder to try and clear the clog and would need a 100â€™ hose, which I had and offered.  He instead left again for well over an hour.  He came back with a brand-new garden hose and bladder and had the clog cleared in about 15 minutes.  I was charged another $750 because he was there for â€œ5 hoursâ€.  This job could have been completed in a fraction of the time, but I guess when youâ€™re charging by the hour, even the hours you arenâ€™t actually at my home, you take your sweet time and try to look busy.

I canâ€™t speak to their other services, but if you have a plumbing issue, save your money, and sanity, and hire someone else.
reviews.ownerResponse:
Mr. Pierce, allow me to first say that we are not happy with the results of a service call if the customer is not happy. We take pride in our work and regret that you feel so incensed about your experience with us. In fact, management adjusted your bill when you voiced your concerns, and so this review took us by surprise.

To address a few of the items you mentioned: when we arrive at a customer location, we really must follow the appropriate steps to diagnose and address a problem. Though we understand that you attempted snaking and plunging, we must act based on knowledge and experience that a customer may not necessarily have. As far as the trip to acquire parts: despite the hose you had on hand, the technician also needed to acquire fittings and a correctly sized bladder. A trip was necessary, and you were not charged for that trip. Nor did we charge for any breaks or indeed any time that the technician was not working to solve your problem.

Once again, we regret your dissatisfaction, though we disagree with your characterization of the service we provided. We attempted to address your concerns with a billing adjustment and now this reply.

reviews.text:
Mr. Webb and his associate did a great job for my family.  Our old heat pump had broken down, and wasn't repairable, so Mr. Webb was able to get a new high quality heat pump unit at a very reasonable price, and got it installed smoothly and quickly.

Before I decided to make a purchase, Mr. Webb went over all of my options, and explained things to me in a way that someone who isn't a HVAC expert would understand.

He pointed out that the current refrigerant standard of R410A was being phased out at the end of this year, and was able to get me one based on the new standard (R32).

It's great to see that there are companies out there, especially small businesses, that are owned by honest folks who truly care about their customers.  I will definitely be using Mr. Webb's company for the forseeable future.

reviews.text:
Can't say enough good things about McCoy and Calvary Climate. Veteran owned and local family man, he's a great guy, very considerate and respectful.

I called 3 places for service when our air went out on Saturday before Memorial Day, and each place wanted $225-$300 for an "emergency" holiday call, just to show up, not including parts, labor or fixing the problem.

McCoy showed up within 20 minutes of calling him and had our air fixed 10 minutes later. Total cost from Calvary Climate was less than just the service fee for showing up the other companies wanted.

I'm getting him back out next week to clean and inspect the rest of my system before summer hits. Only a $69 fee you can't beat!

If you are having issues, do your family a favor and call, you can thank me later. Even if you aren't having issues now, the $69 fee is well worth the money to have him clean the coils, check all the capacitors, other system parts and the drainage. He won't lie or try to sell you anything you don't need, but he may find something that might become an issue and leave you without AC. Better to stay ahead of possible issues and replace things on your time frame rather than wake up hot and have no choice.
